alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 20 at 4:14PM AKST until January 22 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM FRIDAY TO 1 AM AKST SATURDAY SOUTH OF GLENNALLEN... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina and along the Edgerton Highway to Chitina. Freezing rain may spread northward to Glennallen Friday night. * WHEN...From 8 AM Friday to 1 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Driving may become dangerous. Initial snow may promote reduced visibility followed by icy conditions. Which may result in downed power lines and falling tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop south of Glennallen by Friday morning. The heaviest snow is expected along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. Snow is expected to change over to freezing rain Friday afternoon as warm southerly winds develop. The freezing rain is expected to be light with downsloping bringing an end to most precipitation through the morning hours on Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
